column5: LIGHT Beer batter. Not bad. LOL
Thanks for the report buddy! Nice little feed of yella'belly candy there, tried for the same today with zero results lol. Sweet smallies too bud, keep at 'er
Great report and nice shooting Brian!  Looks like a great time was had
Time to retire the flips and go modern with leats say a Minkota. If you only use one flipper you'll be going in circles
Nice trip Brian hopefully your foot heals quickly.  Art

Thanks Fellas   Time to retire the flips and go modern with leats say a Minkota.If you only use one flipper you'll be going in circles  No going in circles bud. There is a knack to flipping the toon. I was still able to have enough motion with one flipper to drag a tube just at the right speed and straight.   I can turn that thing on a dime when I want. LOL  BTW  That kitty was about 3-4 inches long. I think he or she, thought I was mama. LOL I was going to scoop it up with my hands, but thought different. Im sure the little stingers were still sharp enough to give me a prick. It just stayed by my toon for about 10 minutes. Was very cool.
DSCF3676.JPG  LIGHT Beer batter. Not bad.  That beer is OK for cooking but you'll need something better to drink!!

Nice report Brian and a nice feed. Sorry about the flipper injury. ICE it. Ice, compression and elevation. No big deal unless a bone is sticking out. Tape it up and get back in the huddle.  PS. Time to get a "real" boat and ditch the Flintstone Floatmobile? Ya ain't gettin' any younger boyo. And guess what? It gets exponentially worse every year, then every 6 months then every month, you get the formula.  Cooked up the last of some nice size Simcoe Perch. I coated them in crushed Miss Vickie's tater chips, really great. Don't add salt.
